intro: Aklema peganoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf peganum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its upright, branched stems. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by small, fleshy berries. Aklema peganoides is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
